fields.description:
Using the [Eclipse Memory Analyzer|http://www.eclipse.org/mat/downloads.php] there are two potential leaks when running the UPS  potentials

* Problem Suspect 1
{code}
One instance of "org.hornetq.core.paging.impl.PagingManagerImpl" loaded by "org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader @ 0xb26cfd50" occupies 144,656,512 (38.17%) bytes. The memory is accumulated in one instance of "java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap$Segment[]" loaded by "<system class loader>".
 
Keywords
org.hornetq.core.paging.impl.PagingManagerImpl
org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader @ 0xb26cfd50
java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap$Segment[]
{code}

* Problem Suspect 2
{code}
One instance of "org.hornetq.core.journal.impl.JournalImpl" loaded by "org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader @ 0xb26cfd50" occupies 91,759,128 (24.21%) bytes. The memory is accumulated in one instance of "java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap$Segment[]" loaded by "<system class loader>".
 
Keywords
org.hornetq.core.journal.impl.JournalImpl
org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader @ 0xb26cfd50
java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap$Segment[]
{code}
fields.summary: Investigate potential HortnetQ memory leak issues in UPS usage

comments.body: [~jmesnil] Hi Jeff, does the above ring a bell, or is there something we can improve in our HornetQ usage, generally?
[~kpiwko] I don't recall the name, but [~lfryc] said that he worked w/ a EAP/HornetQ person in the past on this. Karel, do you have a contact on this as well ?
[~pslavicek] would you be able to put somebody familiar with HornetQ into the loop? Thanks!

Configuration for JMS/Hornet is located here:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unifiedpush-server/blob/1.1.x-dev/servers/ups-as7/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/hornetq-jms.xml

[~kpiwko][~mwessendorf] Looking at PagingManagerImpl and JournalImpl, the objects which got really huge are maps which contain in-flight transactions. Looks like that something started to fail transactions so HornetQ could not finish them. New and new transactions were started but they failed as well (most likely) and this map got really huge causing OOME (OutOfMemoryError). 

As HornetQ is storing those transactions in file journal as well then when it tries to load journal after restart then new OOME can be thrown as it's putting all "unfinished" transactions to this map again during initialization.

By default there is 5 minute timeout for those transactions and then they're removed. But in this case it seems that memory got full before those transactions could be timeouted.

At this moment this seems to be a symptom but not the cause. Any idea why the transactions are failing? What are the first error messages in server.log?

[~mwessendorf] hornetq-jms.xml just defines which queue/topics should be deployed together with the deployment. I cannot find configuration of the server where this deployment is deployed. Could you help? Is there described what the deployment is doing?

[~mwessendorf] Thanks! It's pretty default configuration. Nothing interesting there. Could you share with me the heap dump so I can take the look?

I would like to take a look at hornetq journal? By default it's located in $JBOSS_HOME/standalone/data/ directory. You can send me the the whole data directory. I'm interested in following directories messagingbindings,  messagingjournal,  messaginglargemessages, messagingpaging.

[~mnovak] Hi Miroslav, I can help you with the code review and stuff.

We have a diagram and a bit of text around our JMS architecture:
https://aerogear.org/docs/unifiedpush/ups_userguide/index/#_jms_internals

The message code lives in these (sub) packages:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unifiedpush-server/tree/1.1.x-dev/push/sender/src/main/java/org/jboss/aerogear/unifiedpush/message

But we can sort that out in a video session :-)
I have attached the data.zip file to this JIRA [~mnovak]. as requested
[~mfreer] Weird, I cannot find any transaction which is see in heap dump in journal. Belong "data" directory to the heap dump? We need to have "data" directory in state when OutOfMemory occurred.
[~pcremin] [~mfreer] can one of you provide the data that [~mnovak] requested ?
Hmm Jira's maximum file size is 20MB's the "DATA" folder is 26 MB each. [~mnovak] I will send both jboss instance data folders by email.

Based on initial investigations, and generally we are still not able to reproduce this, we have a new epic to put together a test-suite.

[~jgallaso] and [~mziccardi] are working on it, and will verify this issue, when they review their findings from the stess-test
